meanings.definition: The act of denying or refusing something.
meanings.sent1: Her denegations of the truth only made the situation worse.
meanings.sent2: The denegations of his request were met with disappointment.
meanings.sent3: His denegations of eating the last cookie were unconvincing.
meanings.sent4: The denegations of responsibility fell on deaf ears.
meanings.sent5: The denegations of the suspect were evident in his nervous demeanor.

meanings.definition: A statement that denies or contradicts something.
meanings.sent1: The denegations in his speech raised suspicions.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't believe the denegations coming from his mouth.
meanings.sent3: His denegations of being late were met with raised eyebrows.
meanings.sent4: The denegations in the report were quickly debunked.
meanings.sent5: The denegations in the courtroom only added to the confusion.

meanings.definition: The act of withholding or refusing to give something.
meanings.sent1: The denegations of access to the files caused frustration.
meanings.sent2: His denegations of the key delayed the process.
meanings.sent3: The denegations of the secret recipe sparked curiosity.
meanings.sent4: Her denegations of the prize created tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The denegations of entry left them standing outside in the rain.
